content.description: The components of a velocity vector are given by the functions <math alttext="v sub x, equals open parenthesis, 2 t minus 2, close parenthesis, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>x</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> and <math alttext="v sub y, equals open parenthesis, t minus 7, close parenthesis, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>y</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>t</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math>, where <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> is the time in seconds. What are the magnitude and direction of the velocity vector at <math alttext="t equals 3 seconds" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mtext> s</mtext></math> ?
content.question: MagnitudeDirectionA<math alttext="4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math><math alttext="45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>45</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">°</mi></math> counterclockwise from the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-directionB<math alttext="4 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math><math alttext="45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>45</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">°</mi></math> clockwise from the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-directionC<math alttext="4 times the square root of 2, end root, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math><math alttext="45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>45</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> counterclockwise from the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-directionD<math alttext="4 times the square root of 2, end root, meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math><math alttext="45 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>45</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> clockwise from the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math>-direction

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
